A Downing Street insider told The Scotsman: While the Tommy Sheridan trial is not the reason he resigned, it is fair to say that it certainly didn't help. "It was one of the many things getting in his way and taking up his time that meant he couldn't do his job properly. "He had to spend two or three days preparing for the trial and these things build up.
